repnme.cdata!:
Guinea-Bissau - Second Petroleum
            Exploration Promotion Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project would assist the Government
            to continue to promote offshore exploration initiated under
            the first project. Under the first project about 14,000 sq.
            km. of deeper offshore acreage has been offered to the oil
            industry for bidding. The proposed project would concentrate
            on the shallow water area and would consist of: (i)
            collection, processing and evaluation of new seismic data in
            the shallow offshore area, extending from the coastline to
            the 20 meter water depth; (ii) evaluation of this new data
            and its integration with existing information; (iii)
            preparation of a report on the shallow water area and its
            promotion within the industry; (iv) negotiation of
            exploration and production contracts in this area with oil
            companies; (v) monitoring the work programs of these
            companies once exploration begins; (vi) institutional
            support and training; and (vii) preparation of a petroleum
            pricing study. The project would help determine the
            existence of economically exploitable oil deposits in the
            shallow water area and is expected to attract foreign
            capital for intensive exploration work.
